Package edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4

Class C4_Killer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.C4_Killer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.IAuto, edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.Jugador
    public class C4_Killer
extends java.lang.Object
implements edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.Jugador, edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.IAuto
    C4_Killer is a class that implements the "Jugador" and "IAuto" interfaces. It represents a Connect 4 AI player that makes moves using a minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning. The AI also records the time and selected column for each move during the game.

      • moviment

        public int moviment​(edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.Tauler t,
                    int color)
        This method calculates the best move for the AI using the minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning. It iterates through all possible moves and evaluates them.
        Specified by:
        moviment in interface edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.Jugador
        Parameters:
        t - The current board state.
        color - The color of the AI player (either 1 or -1).
        Returns:
        The selected column for the next move.

      • getTopPiece

        public int getTopPiece​(edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.Tauler t,
                       int column)
        This method checks the last color placed in a specific column.
        Parameters:
        t - The current board state.
        column - The column to check.
        Returns:
        The color of the last piece in the specified column.

        public void showStatistics()

      • minimaxMaxMovement

        public int minimaxMaxMovement​(edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.MinimaxContext context)
        Maximizing function for the minimax algorithm. It tries to maximize the AI's score.
        Parameters:
        context - The current context containing the board, depth, color, and alpha-beta bounds.
        Returns:
        The best value for the AI's move.

      • minimaxMinMovement

        public int minimaxMinMovement​(edu.epsevg.prop.lab.c4.MinimaxContext context)
        Minimizing function for the minimax algorithm. It tries to minimize the opponent's score.
        Parameters:
        context - The current context containing the board, depth, color, and alpha-beta bounds.
        Returns:
        The best value for the opponent's move.

        Heuristic evaluation function for the current board state based on consecutive pieces.
        Parameters:
